column1: Other
column2: mistique2u@aol.com, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Had PRK surgery, the medication little by little was making me dizzy each day I got dizzier.  My sugar was ALWAYS 120 everyday it got higer and higher over 240.  I stopped using this medication after 7 days the doc wanted me to use it for a MONTH.  If you use this med and feel dizzy get off it ASAP and call your doc. ALWAYS READ REVIEWS AND SIDE EFFECTS.  MAKES A BIG DIFFERENCE!!

column1: Other
column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I had cataract surgery and a limbal relaxing incision to both eyes.  I have been on this medication for nearly two months since I had both eyes done separately.  My only complaint is the burning following placing the drops in my eyes.  My vision is milky at first. I like that you slowly decrease the dosage.  I had no trouble with bad taste, etc. as others reported.

column9: I have been taking this medicine for about 3 weeks 3x a day(cornea transplant). I'm sure it's doing the job it's supposed to but in the process......the bad taste, sick to the stomach, burning as it goes down feels like indigestion. I hate thinking about taking it because the taste in your mouth takes forever to go away. My stomach has been hurting for the past couple of days with a burning feeling. Will call the doctor monday morning.

column1: Inflammation of the Eye Following Surgery

column9: I was prescribed this medicine following a glaucoma value implant shunt. i have to take it 8 x a day it has been already 3 weeks & I was told in 2 more weeks they would start tapering me slowey down. I hate taken this medcine Ive took it before do to urtetis. it stings after using it and I feel kinda depressed my nose is stuffed up cant breath, keep a headache, and I almost feel drunk. I feel like crap & all I want to do is sleep. i was extremly irriated late night I have a real bad attitude & cant wait to get off this terrible drug. I know it working however the doc who see me once a week said it was healing. Its horrible to have to go thru this if youve never experienced it. I wish they could come up with a drug with no side effects.@ ues I get that bitter taste also & a white milky mess in the corner of my eye after taken it its kinda stringly like to try & remove it out. Yuck is all I can say.

column2: Kiwi, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I suffer from Uveitis which is inflammation of the iris. I am back on the pred-forte 1 drop 4X a day. The pred-forte makes me swell up. My cloths are tight, my joints are swollen, and I'm sure that my pressure is up in my eye. I am not happy about taking this medicine. As the side effects for me are getting unbearable. My feet were so swollen last night i couldn't get them in my sandles I can't imagine how I'll be in 3 weeks from now.

column1: Inflammation of the Eye Following Surgery
column2: jennyb5149, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: prescribed following PRK vision correction surgery.  OD says that it will slow healing but reduces risk of vision regression following surgery.  Will be taking for 8 weeks following surgery slowly weaning from 6 times/day to once a day.  Vision gets a bit milky for a minute after application and drops sting for a few seconds.  Discomfort and vision blurring is well worth my long term eye health and vision!

column1: Inflammation of the Uvea of the Eye
column2: 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: Diagnosed with iritis, took this med along with dilating med (AK-Pentolate, or cyclopentolate) over the course of approx 3-4 wks.  Main discomfort appeared from the dilating med, which also caused blurred vision.I kept the remainder of Pred Forte (prednisolone) after course of treatment and have used a drop on occasion when experiencing various eye irritations.  However, only 1 drop at night before bed will usually do the trick.  I wear contacts and try to make sure that I don't get any uptake from the contacts.Overall, this has been a very helpful med.

column1: Other
column2: Didi, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: This medication was prescribed to me after I had PRK (lasic) surgery.  It took awhile for my vision to get better but it was due to the dosage.  I went from 4 drops a day to one drop a day.  The good thing about all of this is that I have severe allergies combines with sinus pain and pressure. Since I've been on these drops, I have not had any issues.  I have actually been able to enjoy the nice weather without any discomforts at all.  I will be talking to my doctor to see if I can stay on them longer to control my allergies.

column1: Inflammation of the Iris - the Colored Part of the Eyeball
column2: IRITIS, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I was given this medication to treat IRITIS, something I have never heard of before.  I was diagnosed 4 years ago, when it flares up, I have runny eye, light sensitive, redness,headaches, runny nose they say its an inflammation of the iris.  It keeps coming back each year. I was told that i can rotate from eye to eye which I have not experienced (thankful for that).They always put me on this steriod eye drop Pred Forte.  All I can say is that it works for me and I hope it always will as long as this mess keeps popin up.

column1: Inflammation of the Eye Following Surgery
column2: Banded Vixen, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: i was given this medicine to take every 2 hours for the first 3 weeks after an eye globe repair surgery that followed after being seriously injured (poked in the eye). it has worked very well for me. i am now taking it 4x a day. because of the extent of my injury and my retina in danger of detachment, i will on this medicine for a long while. i am also being treated with atropine sulfate 1x a day. the only thing i dont like is the bitter taste and sometimes, not always, gives me dry throat. and yes, the eye is connected to the nose and sinus.
